intro: Cyrtandra hypochrysea, commonly known as the Hawaiian whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Cyrtandra hypochrysea is also known for its ecological importance in supporting local insect and bird populations.
